result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven S. Sherrill

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: to Preliminary Hearing
of Judge filed by Atty Cicchini.

Defendant Steven S. Sherrill in court.  Attorney Michael D. Cicchini in court for Steven S. Sherrill.  Prosecuting attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.  DE requests substitution of Br 6; Br 1 assigned.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 09:00 am.

1:28 PM
Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Michael Cicchini. Clerk JT  Minutes: The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:15 am. Bond continued as previously set. ec
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Atty Michael Cicchini

  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person. DE waives time for the prelim hrg.  DE now eligible.   jk

02:58 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Bond continued as previously set.  DE wants to re-apply w/ SPD and Court provides DE with advocate counsel application.  ts
Fr: Court re: rotation. Copy mailed to DE by clerk.
